values.description:
The method implemented does the following:

 - Check for glxinfo application
 - If found, run it and grep GLEW_EXT_Framebuffer_object symbol (see issue #318, 2º comment for details)
 - If not found, try to run a python (pyopengl) helper script
 - If no pyopengl is installed, the script will throw an exception catched by cmake and return false in the VALID_DRI_DISPLAY.

If runned both, glxinfo or gl-test.py script, and the DISPLAY variable is not present (imaging a system without X enviroment), it will return false in VALID_DRI_DISPLAY.
values.title: Check for DRI capable display in cmake

summary.raw:
The method implemented does the following:

 - Check for glxinfo application
 - If found, run it and grep GLEW_EXT_Framebuffer_object symbol (see issue #318, 2º comment for details)
 - If not found, try to run a python (pyopengl) helper script
 - If no pyopengl is installed, the script will throw an exception catched by cmake and return false in the VALID_DRI_DISPLAY.

If runned both, glxinfo or gl-test.py script, and the DISPLAY variable is not present (imaging a system without X enviroment), it will return false in VALID_DRI_DISPLAY.
summary.html:
The method implemented does the following:

  • Check for glxinfo application
  • If found, run it and grep GLEW_EXT_Framebuffer_object symbol (see issue #318, 2º comment for details)
  • If not found, try to run a python (pyopengl) helper script
  • If no pyopengl is installed, the script will throw an exception catched by cmake and return false in the VALID_DRI_DISPLAY.

If runned both, glxinfo or gl-test.py script, and the DISPLAY variable is not present (imaging a system without X enviroment), it will return false in VALID_DRI_DISPLAY.

values.description:
Error case:
gzsdf convert <some_bad_file>

If the file was a pre-1.0 gazebo file it would segfault. Other files would produce bad output.

This should fix those two cases.

values.description:
Use the gz_build_tests macro to include always the gtest gazebo headers.

This will fix issue #476 (broken current gazebo default if no gtest installed in the system) and probably prevent other future problems like this.

Also migrate msg/ and tools/ to use the gz_builds_test so people is not copying around the solutions made there.
values.title: Auto include gtest gazebo dir when using gz_build_tests

summary.raw:
Use the gz_build_tests macro to include always the gtest gazebo headers.

This will fix issue #476 (broken current gazebo default if no gtest installed in the system) and probably prevent other future problems like this.

Also migrate msg/ and tools/ to use the gz_builds_test so people is not copying around the solutions made there.
summary.html:
Use the gz_build_tests macro to include always the gtest gazebo headers.

This will fix issue #476 (broken current gazebo default if no gtest installed in the system) and probably prevent other future problems like this.

Also migrate msg/ and tools/ to use the gz_builds_test so people is not copying around the solutions made there.

values.description:
Added functions to help distinguish between getting velocity at the origin of the link and at center of gravity.

Added a new function for getting velocity of a point on a body.

`GetWorldLinearVel(const math::Vector3 &_offset)`

All physics tests (`test/regression/physics`) should now pass

Fix for issue #376

UPDATE by scpeters:

Added Link::GetWorldLinearVel(math::Pose), which allows specifying the offset in an arbitrary reference frame

Refactored SpawnDropCoGOffset tests and added more expectations based on rolling without slip.

This pull request also fixes issue #349
values.title: Link's linear vel and CoG vel

summary.raw:
Added functions to help distinguish between getting velocity at the origin of the link and at center of gravity.

Added a new function for getting velocity of a point on a body.

`GetWorldLinearVel(const math::Vector3 &_offset)`

All physics tests (`test/regression/physics`) should now pass

Fix for issue #376

UPDATE by scpeters:

Added Link::GetWorldLinearVel(math::Pose), which allows specifying the offset in an arbitrary reference frame

Refactored SpawnDropCoGOffset tests and added more expectations based on rolling without slip.

This pull request also fixes issue #349
summary.html:
Added functions to help distinguish between getting velocity at the origin of the link and at center of gravity.

Added a new function for getting velocity of a point on a body.

GetWorldLinearVel(const math::Vector3 &_offset)

All physics tests (test/regression/physics) should now pass

Fix for issue #376

UPDATE by scpeters:

Added Link::GetWorldLinearVel(math::Pose), which allows specifying the offset in an arbitrary reference frame

Refactored SpawnDropCoGOffset tests and added more expectations based on rolling without slip.

This pull request also fixes issue #349

values.description:
Major update in SensorManager. There are now three threads:

  1) The main thread updates image-based sensors

  2) The second sensor updates ray sensors

  3) The last thread updates other sensors

Also added a MultiCamera GUI viewer.
values.title: Threaded sensors

summary.raw:

values.description:
This patch offers fixes for issues #479, #480.

Issue #480 was related to a strange behavior when attempting to verify roll without slip in a diagonal direction relative to the world XY axes. Test cases were added to SpawnDropCoGOffset in physics.cc that would pass in ODE but fail in Bullet. Changing a solver parameter in BulletPhysics enabled 2 friction directions and resolved the issue.

While modifying SpawnDropCoGOffset, failures to the JointDampingTest were observed. By setting the random seed at the beginning of the test, it now passes. Some changes to the underlying PhysicsEngine class were required to properly pass `math::Rand::GetSeed()` to the derived classes.
values.title: Bullet: enable multiple friction directions, fix brittle JointDamping test (fix #479, #480)

summary.raw:
This patch offers fixes for issues #479, #480.

Issue #480 was related to a strange behavior when attempting to verify roll without slip in a diagonal direction relative to the world XY axes. Test cases were added to SpawnDropCoGOffset in physics.cc that would pass in ODE but fail in Bullet. Changing a solver parameter in BulletPhysics enabled 2 friction directions and resolved the issue.

While modifying SpawnDropCoGOffset, failures to the JointDampingTest were observed. By setting the random seed at the beginning of the test, it now passes. Some changes to the underlying PhysicsEngine class were required to properly pass `math::Rand::GetSeed()` to the derived classes.
summary.html:
This patch offers fixes for issues #479, #480.

Issue #480 was related to a strange behavior when attempting to verify roll without slip in a diagonal direction relative to the world XY axes. Test cases were added to SpawnDropCoGOffset in physics.cc that would pass in ODE but fail in Bullet. Changing a solver parameter in BulletPhysics enabled 2 friction directions and resolved the issue.

While modifying SpawnDropCoGOffset, failures to the JointDampingTest were observed. By setting the random seed at the beginning of the test, it now passes. Some changes to the underlying PhysicsEngine class were required to properly pass math::Rand::GetSeed() to the derived classes.

values.description:
Added a converter move function to do what's described in issue #286.

Also implemented intermediate conversion between SDF versions, 
e.g. converting from 1.2 to 1.4 was not possible before because of missing 1_2.convert file in sdf/1.4 dir. but now it works by finding intermediate SDF dirs (1.3) and iteratively convert towards the current SDF version.

Added a unit test for the move function.
values.title: SDF Converter Move function

summary.raw:
Added a converter move function to do what's described in issue #286.

Also implemented intermediate conversion between SDF versions, 
e.g. converting from 1.2 to 1.4 was not possible before because of missing 1_2.convert file in sdf/1.4 dir. but now it works by finding intermediate SDF dirs (1.3) and iteratively convert towards the current SDF version.

Added a unit test for the move function.
summary.html:
Added a converter move function to do what's described in issue #286.

Also implemented intermediate conversion between SDF versions, e.g. converting from 1.2 to 1.4 was not possible before because of missing 1_2.convert file in sdf/1.4 dir. but now it works by finding intermediate SDF dirs (1.3) and iteratively convert towards the current SDF version.

Added a unit test for the move function.

values.description:
Use ```EXPECT_FLOAT_EQ``` and ```EXPECT_DOUBLE_EQ``` in checks involving such types.

Change the EXPECT_NEAR for above simpler solutions since we don't need more fine grained control over the expected errors than default in FLOAT_EQ and DOUBLE_EQ (4 ULP's).

Change the EXPECT_NEAR for above simpler solutions since we don't need more fine grained control over the expected errors than default in FLOAT_EQ and DOUBLE_EQ (4 ULP's).
summary.html:
Use EXPECT_FLOAT_EQ and EXPECT_DOUBLE_EQ in checks involving such types.

Change the EXPECT_NEAR for above simpler solutions since we don't need more fine grained control over the expected errors than default in FLOAT_EQ and DOUBLE_EQ (4 ULP's).

values.description:
There is a problem generating pssm shadows when the directional light vector is perpendicular to ogre camera's direction vector. This causes an assert failure (Issue #470) which is also reproduceable in Ogre itself.

The workaround sets gazebo's LightMaker to create a non-unit-z directional light. This also happens to remove artifacts seen on the ground plane.
values.title: Directional light workaround

values.description:
Currently we use separate world files to specify the physics engine, but this is a synchronization problem we shouldn't have to deal with. This pull request allows the physics engine specified in a world file to be over-ridden by a command-line parameter.

For example, `gazebo -e bullet` will open the default empty world with the bullet engine. `gazebo -e bullet sdf/worlds/double_pendulums.world`.

The ability to over-ride the physics engine was added to ServerFixture as well, so that we don't need to maintain duplicate world files for testing the physics engines.

Fixes issue #486.

UPDATE:
Added GetType() method to PhysicsEngine and verify that proper physics engine type is loaded in regression tests.

Refactor Server::LoadFile according to Nate's suggestion.
values.title: Fix for #486: Specify physics engine on command line

summary.raw:
Currently we use separate world files to specify the physics engine, but this is a synchronization problem we shouldn't have to deal with. This pull request allows the physics engine specified in a world file to be over-ridden by a command-line parameter.

For example, `gazebo -e bullet` will open the default empty world with the bullet engine. `gazebo -e bullet sdf/worlds/double_pendulums.world`.

The ability to over-ride the physics engine was added to ServerFixture as well, so that we don't need to maintain duplicate world files for testing the physics engines.

Fixes issue #486.

UPDATE:
Added GetType() method to PhysicsEngine and verify that proper physics engine type is loaded in regression tests.

Refactor Server::LoadFile according to Nate's suggestion.
summary.html:
Currently we use separate world files to specify the physics engine, but this is a synchronization problem we shouldn't have to deal with. This pull request allows the physics engine specified in a world file to be over-ridden by a command-line parameter.

For example, gazebo -e bullet will open the default empty world with the bullet engine. gazebo -e bullet sdf/worlds/double_pendulums.world.

The ability to over-ride the physics engine was added to ServerFixture as well, so that we don't need to maintain duplicate world files for testing the physics engines.

Fixes issue #486.

UPDATE: Added GetType() method to PhysicsEngine and verify that proper physics engine type is loaded in regression tests.

Refactor Server::LoadFile according to Nate's suggestion.

values.description:
Define macros ```gz_build_display_tests``` and ```gz_build_dri_tests```. Issue #478
These macros are defined empty if not valid support is found.

Note that currently both of them are generating qt tests (reusing the old gz_qt_build_tests). I'm not sure if this will be correct for all the cases (i.e: tests needed display but not using qt). What do you think?
values.title: Support for gz_build_display_tests and gz_build_dri_tests

summary.raw:
Define macros ```gz_build_display_tests``` and ```gz_build_dri_tests```. Issue #478
These macros are defined empty if not valid support is found.

Note that currently both of them are generating qt tests (reusing the old gz_qt_build_tests). I'm not sure if this will be correct for all the cases (i.e: tests needed display but not using qt). What do you think?
summary.html:
Define macros gz_build_display_tests and gz_build_dri_tests. Issue #478 These macros are defined empty if not valid support is found.

Note that currently both of them are generating qt tests (reusing the old gz_qt_build_tests). I'm not sure if this will be correct for all the cases (i.e: tests needed display but not using qt). What do you think?

values.title: Added ClearModelPaths and AddModelPaths for the ModelPath, analog to the other system paths

summary.html:
This can be used to set up the environment for gazebo_simulator in ROS with the following patch for gazebo_simulator's gazebo_ros_paths_plugin:

Index: gazebo/src/gazebo_ros_paths_plugin.cpp
===================================================================
--- gazebo/src/gazebo_ros_paths_plugin.cpp  (revision 40361)
+++ gazebo/src/gazebo_ros_paths_plugin.cpp  (working copy)
@@ -151,7 +151,7 @@
       */

       // set gazebo media paths by adding all packages that exports "gazebo_media_path" for gazebo
-      gazebo::common::SystemPaths::Instance()->ClearGazeboPaths();
+      //gazebo::common::SystemPaths::Instance()->ClearGazeboPaths();
       gazebo::common::SystemPaths::Instance()->gazeboPathsFromEnv = false;
       std::vector<std::string> gazebo_media_paths;
       rosPackageGetPluginsDebug("gazebo","gazebo_media_path",gazebo_media_paths);
@@ -161,8 +161,8 @@
         gazebo::common::SystemPaths::Instance()->AddGazeboPaths(iter->c_str());
       }

-      // set gazebo plugins paths by adding all packages that exports "plugin" for gazebo
-      gazebo::common::SystemPaths::Instance()->ClearPluginPaths();
+      // set gazebo plugins paths by adding all packages that exports "plugin_path" for gazebo
+      //gazebo::common::SystemPaths::Instance()->ClearPluginPaths();
       gazebo::common::SystemPaths::Instance()->pluginPathsFromEnv = false;
       std::vector<std::string> plugin_paths;
       rosPackageGetPluginsDebug("gazebo","plugin_path",plugin_paths);
@@ -172,6 +172,17 @@
         gazebo::common::SystemPaths::Instance()->AddPluginPaths(iter->c_str());
       }

+      // set model paths by adding all packages that exports "gazebo_model_path" for gazebo
+      //gazebo::common::SystemPaths::Instance()->ClearModelPaths();
+      gazebo::common::SystemPaths::Instance()->modelPathsFromEnv = false;
+      std::vector<std::string> model_paths;
+      rosPackageGetPluginsDebug("gazebo","gazebo_model_path",model_paths);
+      for (std::vector<std::string>::iterator iter=model_paths.begin(); iter != model_paths.end(); iter++)
+      {
+        ROS_DEBUG("model path %s",(*iter).c_str());
+        gazebo::common::SystemPaths::Instance()->AddModelPaths(iter->c_str());
+      }
+
       // set .gazeborc path to something else, so we don't pick up default ~/.gazeborc
       std::string gazeborc = ros::package::getPath("gazebo")+"/.do_not_use_gazeborc";
       setenv("GAZEBORC",gazeborc.c_str(),1);

values.description:
Change to support only defined ```CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE``` values in CamelCase issue #279

Now gazebo will fail automatically when a non defined mode is provided. Currently it fails into default silently which I consider somewhat dangerous for typo errors.

The transition plan is: still suport uppercase modes (i.e. DEBUG) but will generate a warning about deprecation some time soon.
values.title: Support only standard CMAKE format for BUILD_TYPES

summary.raw:
Change to support only defined ```CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE``` values in CamelCase issue #279

Now gazebo will fail automatically when a non defined mode is provided. Currently it fails into default silently which I consider somewhat dangerous for typo errors.

The transition plan is: still suport uppercase modes (i.e. DEBUG) but will generate a warning about deprecation some time soon.
summary.html:
Change to support only defined CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE values in CamelCase issue #279

Now gazebo will fail automatically when a non defined mode is provided. Currently it fails into default silently which I consider somewhat dangerous for typo errors.

The transition plan is: still suport uppercase modes (i.e. DEBUG) but will generate a warning about deprecation some time soon.

values.description:
fix for issue #464

Fix problem of duplicating joint visuals and incorrect pose. Now Joints publish pose relative to child link instead of absolute pose.  

The joint visual currently displays the axis of rotation incorrectly and that's due to issue #494
values.title: Fix joint visualization

fix for issue #464

The joint visual currently displays the axis of rotation incorrectly and that's due to issue #494

values.description:
This correctly aggregates pose messages, which in turn eliminates jitter in visualizations.

Also introduced the ability the set a Hz rate for a publisher. The default Hz rate is unlimited.
values.title: Stop jitter of visualized links

summary.raw:
This correctly aggregates pose messages, which in turn eliminates jitter in visualizations.

Also introduced the ability the set a Hz rate for a publisher. The default Hz rate is unlimited.
summary.html:
This correctly aggregates pose messages, which in turn eliminates jitter in visualizations.

Also introduced the ability the set a Hz rate for a publisher. The default Hz rate is unlimited.

values.description:
It takes almost 2 minutes on my machine, but much of that time is spent throttling the physics updates. This speeds it up substantially.

This should be re-targeted to default after pull request #288 is merged.
values.title: Speed up physics regression test

values.description:
Issue #506 

Ubuntu unity native menu does not update when gazebo switches between different Qt menubars. So the solution is to delete the attached menu bar and create a new one as suggested by posts in qt forum.
values.title: Fix native menu bar when switching in and out of building editor

values.description:
issue #495

Added more tests to regression/laser.cc. Bullet ray test returns range results that are more noisy so a high tolerance, `LASER_TOL`, is set.
values.title: Fix ray sensor in bullet
